availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles F. Lowry (Fayette County, Kentucky merchant and deputy clerk)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, merchant and deputy court clerk. Kentucky native. Father of Eliza Jane Lowry. Married to Miranda H. Payne Lowry. Father of Susan H. Lowry, Mary F. Lowry, J. H. Lowry, William F. Lowry, Melvin T. Lowry, and John B. Lowry, Julia B. Lowery, Miranda P. Lowry. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1840. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1840. Merchant in Jessamine County in 1850. Employed George M. Neal and Meredith Masters as merchants in Jessamine County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Merchant in Lexington in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Lexington in 1860. Deputy clerk in the Fayette Circuit Court in March 1864.
